intro: Fagelia perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate fagelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive perfoliate leaves, which have a hole through the center, allowing the stem to pass through. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in late summer. Fagelia perfoliata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
